info.michaelkohler.helpertools.io

Class CSVExporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.michaelkohler.helpertools.io.CSVExporter

  • public class CSVExporter
extends java.lang.Object
    The |CSVExporter| can be used to export different data into a CSV file. It doesn't matter what you choose as source, the resulting CSV file looks always the same.
    Version:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Michael Kohler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CSVExporter()
      Constructor which initializes an standard |CSVExporter|.
      CSVExporter(java.lang.String aPath)
      Constructor which configures the specified path for the CSV.
      CSVExporter(java.lang.String aPath, char aSeparator)
      Constructor which configures the specified path for the CSV and the separator.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getCSVPath()
      Returns the current CSV file path.
      char getSeparator()
      Returns the separator used to separate values in the resulting file
      void setCSVPath(java.lang.String aPath)
      Sets the path to the CSV file.
      void setSeparator(char aSeparator)
      Sets the separator which should be used to separate values in the file
      void writeCSVFileFromJTable(javax.swing.JTable aTable)
      Exports all the data from a JTable into a CSV.

        Parameters:
        aPath - path to the CSV file

      • writeCSVFileFromJTable

        public void writeCSVFileFromJTable(javax.swing.JTable aTable)
        Exports all the data from a JTable into a CSV. Every cell of the JTable is a entity in the CSV. Every line of the JTable is a line in the CSV. You get the data as seen in the JTable.
        Parameters:
        aTable - to get the data from
        See Also:
        setSeparator(char), JTable
